definition: to bite the hand that feeds one (idiom)
favor/grace/kindness
variant of 恩[en1]
to desire/to invite/to request
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])
general/commander-in-chief (military)/king (chess piece)/to command/to lead
hatred/animosity/enmity/foe/enemy/to feel animosity toward (the wealthy, foreigners etc)
spouse/companion
surname Qiu
to announce/to inform/report/newspaper/recompense/revenge/CL:份[fen4],張|张[zhang1]

sentences.english: The person always returns ingratitude for kindness.
sentences.chinese: 这个家伙常常恩将仇报。

sentences.english: I hate people who shit where they eat.
sentences.chinese: 我讨厌那种恩将仇报的人。

sentences.english: And I thanked her by becoming a lunatic and denting her car.
sentences.chinese: 我却恩将仇报，象个疯子一样撞了她的车。

sentences.english: Don't you know she's the one that would bite the hand that feeds her?
sentences.chinese: 你难道不知道她是个教你怎么写小说恩将仇报的人？

sentences.english: He did this for you. How could bite the hand that feeds you?
sentences.chinese: 他这么做全是为了你，你怎么能恩将仇报呢？

definition: to forget favors and violate justice (idiom); ingratitude to a friend/to kick a benefactor in the teeth
lit. heart of wolf and lungs of dog (idiom)/cruel and unscrupulous
ungrateful
breaking faith and abandoning right (idiom); to betray/treachery/perfidy
lit. to destroy the bridge after crossing the river (idiom)/fig. to abandon one's benefactor upon achieving one's goal
to be ungrateful
to return good for evil (idiom)/to requite evil with good
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
grateful and seeking to repay the kindness (idiom)
death cannot wipe out the crimes (idiom); dreadful crimes that rankled even after the perpetrator is dead
completely lacking any feeling or sense of justice (idiom); cold and ruthless
to make a false countercharge
human face, beast's heart (idiom); two-faced/malicious and duplicitous
worse than a beast/to behave immorally
lit. to strike with a muckrake (idiom), cf Pigsy 豬八戒|猪八戒 in Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记; fig. to counterattack/to make bogus accusations (against one's victim)
unable to tell good from bad (idiom)/undiscriminating
